text: Kim Da-mi (born April 9, 1995) is a South Korean actress. She is best known for playing the titular role in action-mystery film The Witch: Part 1. The Subversion (2018). She is also known for her role in the television series Itaewon Class (2020). ==Career== Kim made her debut in the movie world through the independent film 2017 Project With The Same Name, an omnibus feature film produced annually with the concept of 'A Neighborhood, A Story of Two People'. Kim played in the episode 'Hello, My Hard Work' is the story of a man and woman who broke up. In 2018, Kim played the role of a high school student in mystery thriller film Marionette. The same year, Kim proved her outstanding acting ability when she played the lead role in action-mystery film The Witch: Part 1. The Subversion by director Park Hoon-jung. Kim won the role of protagonist Koo Ja-yoon after beating 1,500 hopefuls in an open audition. She received universal acclaim for her strong performance in a challenging role that included intense fighting scenes, winning a large number of newcomer awards, and she was enthusiastically welcomed as a rising star who suddenly appeared in Chungmuro. Meanwhile, thanks to the success and popularity of The Witch: Part 1. The Subversion, 'The Witch' is currently scheduled to produce a sequel. In 2020, Kim made her television debut in the cable series Itaewon Class, based on the webtoon of the same title. Kim won the Baeksang Arts Award for Best New Actress (TV) for her performance. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable"| Notes !
